formattedAddress: 142 West 65th Street, Lincoln Center Plaza, New York, NY 10023, USA
adrFormatAddress: 142 West 65th Street, Lincoln Center Plaza, New York, NY 10023, USA

editorialSummary.text: Glass-walled dining room at Lincoln Center serving upscale Italian fare in an open kitchen.

originalText.text: Elegant Lincoln Center restaurant will not disappoint.  We came here for the Prix Fixe Thanksgiving Dinner and it was an excellent dining experience.  I started with the Burrata which was delicious.  The traditional turkey dinner was moist and fresh, with tasty sides including brussel sprouts and spatzle.  The pumpkin pie for dessert was creamy, and included a delicious side of sorbet.  Service was attentive and friendly.  I was very thankful for this meal.

text.text: Elegant Lincoln Center restaurant will not disappoint.  We came here for the Prix Fixe Thanksgiving Dinner and it was an excellent dining experience.  I started with the Burrata which was delicious.  The traditional turkey dinner was moist and fresh, with tasty sides including brussel sprouts and spatzle.  The pumpkin pie for dessert was creamy, and included a delicious side of sorbet.  Service was attentive and friendly.  I was very thankful for this meal.

originalText.text:
We booked this restaurant due to its convenient location, as we had a show at the Lincoln Center right after dinner.  It’s on the same block and only a couple hundred feet away from the doors of the theater.

When we checked in, we were asked if we were trying to make a particular show time so they could try to accommodate that as best as possible.  We allowed 2.5 hours when choosing our reservation time so it wasn’t an issue, but this would be a very welcome part of the experience for those who might be running on a tighter timeline.   As it turned out, we had an extra hour to spare after we left the restaurant.  With this extra time before our show, we took a stroll down to Venchi, a chocolatier and gelato establishment about 4 blocks away that I highly recommend.

I had the wagyu strip loin, which was served with a very tasty green peppercorn sugo and potato cakes.

They don’t have a kids menu per se, but they had options readily available.  My 7 year-old son ended up going with the butter and cheese pasta.

I definitely recommend this for a wonderful upscale pre-show dining spot.

originalText.text: My husband surprised me with a birthday dinner here before we watched the show Giselle. The servers are super friendly and make me feel very warm welcomed. The food is delicious, especially the cavier on top a small piece of fried potato which was just devine. The octopus was also super delicious with soft but perfectly chewy feeling inside mouth.

text.text: My husband surprised me with a birthday dinner here before we watched the show Giselle. The servers are super friendly and make me feel very warm welcomed. The food is delicious, especially the cavier on top a small piece of fried potato which was just devine. The octopus was also super delicious with soft but perfectly chewy feeling inside mouth.

originalText.text: Have eaten at Lincoln Ristorante a couple of times over the years. This was the first time we've been here for Thanksgiving. The food, service, and atmosphere were all excellent. The 3 course pre-fix at 95 dollars per person also seemed fair as well for the experience we had. We highly recommend Lincoln Ristorante and would definitely come back again over Thanksgiving time or any other time for that matter. This is an excellent restaurant.

We highly recommend Lincoln Ristorante and would definitely come back again over Thanksgiving time or any other time for that matter. This is an excellent restaurant.

originalText.text:
This place is absolutely beautiful, surrounded by glass exterior, which allows the beautiful center to be the backdrop.
The service was kind but our waiter seemed to be rushing us a bit towards the end. Now, for the food.  I'm not big on Italian food but this was an experience.  The agnoletti with oxtail was a party in my mouth.  It was so good,  I had it twice.  Don't skip it.
